solution_line_template: First find the total number of students in third grade {num_third_grade_classes} classes * {students_per_third_grade_class} students/class = <<{num_third_grade_classes}*{students_per_third_grade_class}={total_third_grade_students}>>{total_third_grade_students} students

Then find the total number of students in fourth grade {num_fourth_grade_classes} classes * {students_per_fourth_grade_class} students/class = <<{num_fourth_grade_classes}*{students_per_fourth_grade_class}={total_fourth_grade_students}>>{total_fourth_grade_students} students

Then find the total number of student in fifth grade {num_fifth_grade_classes} classes * {students_per_fifth_grade_class} students/class = <<{num_fifth_grade_classes}*{students_per_fifth_grade_class}={total_fifth_grade_students}>>{total_fifth_grade_students} students

Now add the number of students in each grade to find the total number of students {total_third_grade_students} students + {total_fourth_grade_students} students + {total_fifth_grade_students} students = <<{total_third_grade_students}+{total_fourth_grade_students}+{total_fifth_grade_students}={total_students}>>{total_students} students
Now find the total cost of one lunch ${hamburger_cost} + ${carrots_cost} + ${cookie_cost} = $<<{hamburger_cost}+{carrots_cost}+{cookie_cost}={lunch_cost_per_student}>>{lunch_cost_per_student}

Now multiply that cost by the number of students to find the total cost for the school ${lunch_cost_per_student}/student * {total_students} students = $<<{lunch_cost_per_student}*{total_students}={total_lunch_cost}>>{total_lunch_cost}
